main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tlv

Class TLVObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tlv.TLVObject

  • public class TLVObject
extends java.lang.Object
    A Tag Length Value ASN.1 object. Can convert itself into an ASN.1 DER encoded byte array and can decode those byte arrays back into TLVObjects.
    Author:
    dpottkaemper

    • Method Detail

      • setTagWithByteElement

        public void setTagWithByteElement(byte tagAsByte)
        This is used when the tag is already known in the class constructing the TLVObject. The tag is already known in case of it being found in the ASN1Constants class.
        Parameters:
        tagAsByte - the tag as a single byte

      • setTagWithIntegerElement

        public void setTagWithIntegerElement(int i)
        This is used for all the IMPLICIT types used in the TR.
        Parameters:
        i - the tag as an integer

      • setValue

        public void setValue(byte[] valueAsByteArray)
        Sets the value array from an element already encoded as a byte array. The input byte array must be encoded according to asn1 rules.
        Parameters:
        valueAsByteArray - the value as a byte array

      • setValueWithIntegerElement

        public void setValueWithIntegerElement(int valueAsInt)
        Sets the value from an Integer element, encodes the Integer element according to asn1 rules. The value should, in the context of the simulator, never be smaller than 0.
        Parameters:
        valueAsInt - the value as an integer

      • setValueWithLongElement

        public void setValueWithLongElement(long valueAsLong)
        Sets the value from a long element, converting it to an asn1 encoded INTEGER. he value should, in the context of the simulator, never be smaller than 0.
        Parameters:
        valueAsLong - the value as a long

      • appendChild

        public void appendChild(TLVObject appendix)
                 throws TLVException,
                        ValueNullException,
                        ValueTooBigException
        Appends a TLVObject to a constructed TLVObject
        Parameters:
        appendix - the TLVObject that will be appended to this TLVObject
        Throws:
        TLVException - if the TLVObject is not constructed
        ValueTooBigException - if the value component of the appendix is too long to be encoded
        ValueNullException - if the value component of the appendix has not been set

      • getAllChildren

        public TLVObject[] getAllChildren()
        Returns all children of a TLVObject in the form of an array.
        Uses decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObjectArray(byte[]).
        Returns:
        a TLVObject array containing the child at position 0, if the child is a parent then it contains its child at position 1, ...

      • getTag

        public Tag getTag()
        The getter method for the tag object.
        Returns:
        the tag object

      • getLengthAsByteArray

        public byte[] getLengthAsByteArray()
                            throws ValueNullException,
                                   ValueTooBigException
        Computes and then encodes the length of the value array according to ASN1 DER standard. Should only be called, if the value has been assigned.
        Returns:
        an ASN1 DER encoded representation of the value.
        Throws:
        ValueNullException - the value has not been set or has been reset. Length encoding therefore not possible.
        ValueTooBigException - the value has a length greater than 2^125 - 1 and can't be ASN1 DER encoded.

      • getLengthAsLong

        public long getLengthAsLong()
        Returns the length of the value array as a long. For correctly ASN1 DER encoded length please use getLengthAsByteArray method.
        Returns:
        value.length as a long.

      • toTLVByteArray

        public byte[] toTLVByteArray()
                      throws ValueNullException,
                             ValueTooBigException
        Converts the whole TLVObject into an ASN1 DER encoded byte array.
        Returns:
        the TLVObject as a byte array
        Throws:
        ValueTooBigException - thrown by getLengthAsByteArray() if the length is too big to be encoded.
        ValueNullException - thrown by getLengthAsByteArray() if the value has not been set and therefore is null and the TLV it belongs to is not tagged as a NULL.

      • decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObjectArray

        public static TLVObject[] decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObjectArray(byte[] inputArray)
                                                       throws TLVException
        Takes a byte array as an argument and decodes its contents according to ASN1 DER standard. Used in the TSE simulator to get the log time from the byte array that the CryptoCore returns to the ERSSpecificModule.
        Note: the method distinguishes between primitive and constructed TLVs. If it encounters a constructed TLV, it adds this TLV to the array that it returns, then also adds the child (or children) of the constructed TLV to this array.
        Parameters:
        inputArray - - one or more TLVs encoded as an ASN1 byte array.
        Returns:
        - an array of TLVObjects where each represents one TLV that had been encoded in the byte array.
        Throws:
        TLVException - - if this Exception is thrown by decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObject(byte[], int, int, int) because it could not decode the current TLV.

      • decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObject

        public static TLVObject decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObject(byte[] tlvByteArray)
                                                throws TLVException
        The inverse to toTLVByteArray(). Takes a single encoded TLV element as a byte array and creates a TLVObject from its content. Can currently only handle low tag number form tags. Also does not encode child TLVs, only their "parent" TLV with the child TLV being contained in the value component of the parent.
        Parameters:
        tlvByteArray - - a single TLVObject in its encoded byte array form.
        Returns:
        - a TLVObject with the tag and value encoded in the tlvByteArray.
        Throws:
        TLVException - - If the tlvByteArray is too short to be an ASN1 encoded TLV, if the tag is in high tag number form and/or if the byte array's length does not match (numberOftagOctets + numberOflengthOctets + numberOfValueOctets).

      • decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObject

        private static TLVObject decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObject(byte[] tlvByteArray,
                                                        int numberOfTagOctets,
                                                        int numberOfLengthOctets,
                                                        int numberOfValueOctets)
                                                 throws TLVException
        Overloaded version of the decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObject(byte[]) method. To be used by decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObjectArray(byte[]). The caller of this method has to calculate the number of tag octets, the number of length octets and the number of value octets. Note: can only be called on primitive TLVs because it does not check if its a primitive tlv or not.
        Parameters:
        tlvByteArray - - the whole encoded TLV including the tag and the length octets. Has to be (numberOftagOctets + numberOflengthOctets + numberOfValueOctets) long. This is checked in the method body.
        numberOfTagOctets - - the number of tag octets. Must be counted by the calling method and currently only the value "1" is supported, as the TR-03151 does not specify high tag number form tags.
        numberOfLengthOctets - - the number of length octets. Must be counted by the calling method and can be "1" or more, depending on what kiind of length encoding has been used.
        numberOfValueOctets - - the number of value octets as encoded by the length octets. Must be provided by the calling method.
        Returns:
        - a TLVObject with the tag and value encoded in the tlvByteArray.
        Throws:
        TLVException - - If the tlvByteArray is too short to be an ASN1 encoded TLV, if the tag is in high tag number form and/or if the byte array's length does not match (numberOftagOctets + numberOflengthOctets + numberOfValueOctets).

      • getLengthFromLongFormOfLengthByteArray

        public static int getLengthFromLongFormOfLengthByteArray(byte[] lengthOctets)
        Decodes long form of length asn1 encoded byte arrays to long. Takes only the "following length octets", NOT the first length octet that encodes how many octets encode the length. Should normally only be called by decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObjectArray(byte[]).
        Parameters:
        lengthOctets - - the "following length octets" after the one that encodes how many octets are needed to encode the length.
        Returns:
        - an integer which represents the value encoded in the length octets.

      • verifyTransactionOrSystemLog

        public static boolean verifyTransactionOrSystemLog(java.io.File transysLog,
                                                   CryptoCore cryptoCore)
                                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                                   VerifyingOperationFailedException
        This method can be used to verify a TransactionLogMessage or a SystemLogMessage using a file on the file system and a CryptoCore. The caller of the method has to make sure, that the passed in CryptoCore does use the same signature algorithm on the same curve with the same keys that were used to create the log message. In short, the configuration file of this program has to be set mostly to the same values that were used in the creation of the log message
        Please note: this method was created for internal testing purposes. It is not recommended, to use the TSE, that created the signature on a log message, to verify that same log message.
        Parameters:
        transysLog - a TransactionLogMessage or a SystemLogMessage as a Java File object
        cryptoCore - a CryptoCore with a configuration as mentioned above
        Returns:
        true, if the log message could be verified. False otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading the Java File from the file system fails
        VerifyingOperationFailedException - if something unusual happens during verification. This can be anything from a parsing error to an error in CryptoCore.isVerified(byte[], byte[]) method.
        Since:
        1.5
        See Also:
        CryptoCore#isVerified(byte[], byte[])}, {@linkplain CryptoCore#verify}

      • verifyAuditLog

        public static boolean verifyAuditLog(java.io.File auditLog,
                                     CryptoCore cryptoCore)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     VerifyingOperationFailedException
        Deprecated. Due to AuditLogs not being implemented, this method could not yet be tested.
        Not yet tested, since AuditLogs are not yet implemented!
        This method can be used to verify an AuditLog using a file on the file system and a CryptoCore. The caller of the method has to make sure, that the passed in CryptoCore does use the same signature algorithm on the same curve with the same keys that were used to create the log message. In short, the configuration file of this program has to be set mostly to the same values that were used in the creation of the log message
        Please note: this method was created for internal testing purposes. It is not recommended, to use the TSE, that created the signature on a log message, to verify that same log message.
        Only one additional value is present in audit logs when compared to the other log message types. That is seAuditData. This is the only reason, a separate method dealing with AuditLogs was needed.
        Parameters:
        auditLog - an AuditLog as a Java File object
        cryptoCore - a CryptoCore with a configuration as mentioned above
        Returns:
        true, if the log message could be verified. False otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading the Java File from the file system fails
        VerifyingOperationFailedException - if something unusual happens during verification. This can be anything from a parsing error to an error in CryptoCore.isVerified(byte[], byte[]) method.
        Since:
        1.5
        See Also:
        CryptoCore#isVerified(byte[], byte[])}, {@linkplain CryptoCore#verify}

      • getValue

        public byte[] getValue()
        Getter method for the value. Throws a java.lang.NullPointerException if the value is null.
        Returns:
        the value byte array.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Represents the TLVObject as a human readable String with the usage of Tag.toString() for the Tag, Integer.toHexString(int) for the length and TLVUtility.byteArrayToString(byte[]) for the value.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a human readable representation of the TLVObject

      • toBinaryString

        public java.lang.String toBinaryString()
        Represents the TLVObject as a human readable String in binary form separated by indicators for the elements "Tag", "Length" and "Value". Uses Tag.toBinaryStringWithLeadingZeroes() for the tag and TLVUtility.byteArrayToBinaryString(byte[]) for the ASN1 DER encoded length and the value.
        Returns:
        a binary String representation of the TLVObject.

      • tlvObjectArrayToString

        public static java.lang.String tlvObjectArrayToString(TLVObject[] tlvobjects)
        Static method to convert the contents of one TLVObject array to a String representation. Due to how SEQUENCE TLVs are currently handled, a sequence first appears with its contents as the value and then each content tlv appears.
        Parameters:
        tlvobjects - - an array of TLVObject objects
        Returns:
        a pretty human-readable representation of the content of each TLVObject in the array

      • equals

        public boolean equals(TLVObject tlvObj)
        Determines whether 2 TLVObjects are equal. They are equal, if their tags and their value are equal. Used mainly for testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        tlvObj - the TLVObject to compare this to
        Returns:
        true, if they are equal, false otherwise
